page.title: 01GENERAL VIEW OF THE AREA.
page.content: General area is extremely rural with beautiful scenery,mostly cultivated fields and woodland.There are two villages Luckington and Little Badminton.The land is mainly owned by the Duke of Beaufort,Badminton House is S.W.of the area. Cotswold stone is used in many buildings.Badminton Park dominates most of the area. Luckington; one Public House,Post Office/shop,Off-Licence/newsagent,two chapels,the church of St.Mary and St.Ethelbert,village Primary School and playgroup.Daily bus service to Sherston.Village hall.Recreation field and Sports field. Telephone box.Seven farms arable/dairy.Famous buildings Luckington Court,Luckington Manor. Little Badminton; very tiny hamlet stone cottages.This area is crowded during the Badminton Horse Trials.
